result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lashonda S. Virgil

records.addlTxt: Clerk NN emailed victim witness to advise her of the status of the case. All parties included on the email.

Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Lashonda S. Virgil not in court.  Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Lashonda S. Virgil. Clerk N. Nobile.
NO RECORD: Attorney Barth came to Branch 6 at 9:30 am while ADA Lehman was also in the courtroom. Attorney Barth advised the Court that he can not appear this afternoon for a jury status hearing as he has a conflict with a juvenile case in Racine County. Court requests status of case. Both parties are ready to proceed to trial and Ludwig hearing to held on Monday morning.

10:50 AM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Lashonda S. Virgil, appeared with Attorney Michael Robert Barth.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. Attorney Barth states the matter is not resolved and is requesting the matter be scheduled for trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of assignment of judge returned. Return to sender. Temporarily Away.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Barth.  Clerk. M.Burke.   State in victim rights compliance. STC set to 08/17/22 at 10:30.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Barth. Clerk. M.Burke. Atty Barth states this case is newer and he is still waiting for some discovery. STC set to 07/07/22 at 10:30.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of Judge filed by Atty Barth
Judicial Pretrial - in court on May 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court with Defendant Lashonda S. Virgil.  Clerk: PT
    DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over. DE requests substitution of Br 3; Br 2 assigned.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not Guilty plea entered.  Bond continued. 

  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Anthony A.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's Anthony A's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

01:19 PM    State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Bub.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on March 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  ts
and witness list filed by the State
